method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the 20 most recent statuses from non-protected users who have set a custom user icon. This method doesn't require authentication. For more information, see http://groups.google.com/group/twitter-development-talk/web/api-documentation.

param.name: since_id
param.doc: Returns only public statuses with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of the 20 most recent direct messages sent to the authenticating user. The XML and JSON versions include detailed information about the sending and recipient users. This method requires HTTP Basic Authentication as described at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_authentication_scheme. For more information, see http://groups.google.com/group/twitter-development-talk/web/api-documentation.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Sends a new, direct message to the specified user from the authenticating user. This method requires HTTP Basic Authentication, described at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_authentication_scheme, as well as the user name of the recipient and the text of the message as parameters. Returns the text of the message in the requested format if successful. For more information, see http://groups.google.com/group/twitter-development-talk/web/api-documentation.

param.name: user
param.doc: The ID or screen name of the recipient user.

param.name: text
param.doc: The text of your direct message. Be sure to URL encode it as necessary (as described at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent_encoding) and keep the length under 140 characters.
